title: DOGE Comes for the Pentagon: 5,400 Workers Cut
summary: The Department of Defense announces mass layoffs of probationary civilian workers after DOGE staffers visited with lists. A hiring freeze follows.
content:
The largest government agency in America just got smaller.

## 5,400 | Probationary civilian workers the Pentagon is cutting starting next week

DOGE staffers arrived at the Pentagon earlier this week. They brought lists.

The lists contained the names of every probationary employee — workers on the job less than a year, without civil service protection.

>> "We anticipate reducing the Department's civilian workforce by 5-8% to produce efficiencies and refocus on the President's priorities." — Darin Selnick, Acting Undersecretary of Defense

A hiring freeze follows immediately. No replacements.

## 700,000+ | Total civilian workers at the Department of Defense as of 2023

Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth has also directed the military to identify **$50 billion in programs to cut** — about 8% of the total military budget.

The Pentagon isn't alone. The Forest Service lost 2,000. The IRS is losing 7,000. The pattern is clear.

>> "Cut the fat (HQ) and grow the muscle (warfighters)." — Pete Hegseth on X

The question nobody's answering: who decides what's fat and what's muscle? DOGE staffers with a list — or the people who've spent careers building national defense?

!! The military is exempt. The civilians who keep it running are not.
